messages.message:
Issue: Hi team, It seems like the app version have more than 70 or more will broke this API. API: https://nationwide.aihub.instabase.com/api/v2/aihub/deployments/? Error: ``` Bad Request

Bad Request

Request Line is too large (4127 > 4094) ``` cc : @Alex Sgueglia @Jacky Chen @shreya.rajput

thank you for reporting!

while we investigate the fix, is it possible to delete older app versions as a workaround? see https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CSY11CK7T/p1750864466100809?thread_ts=1750745375.616489&cid=CSY11CK7T
@Jet I can delete some of the older app versions. But I can keep all the deployments right?
Yes, just delete a few app versions and the UI should display
If the deployment is associated with an app version, will the deployment also get deleted?

@Jet @Serena It did work. But looks like it also deleted deployments and some runs attached with it.
is it possible to revert a given run (one of the important ones got deleted)?

per my understanding, the deletion should only delete the versioned APP as specified when deletion. It should not impact actual runs and deployments. (waiting Serena to confirm).

However, from UI, the logic of displaying the jobs and deployments seems exhaustive listing (also Serena can confirm). So it's impacted by missing the corresponding Version and App ID...so it's not listed...

in other words, to recover such jobs, I assume there should be a version or app id matching the missing job...
(I am not sure if it's doable and how to recreate such app versions back though)

looking at this job:
it's tied to deployed_solution_id f0cf37c7-aee3-4ea7-9ee9-9004029261fb with version 5.3.0.
:sweat_smile: I honestly can't think of a way to recreate it . (maybe there could be some backend methods?)
Intuitively:
1. recreate a run with the same id and version might work
    a. don't think we have an api to update the ID
2. maybe we can tie this run to another version and deploy id
    a. don't think we have an api to update these attributes either
3. create a new run, replace the output folder with this job's output folder
    a. this can help quickly bring the view back
    b. however, I am unsure how would this impact the later usage of this run 
    c. (there could be location references within the folders and files to break things)
Let's wait for @Serenaâ€™s inputs.

@shreya.rajput as you mentioned, the run page is accessible

is that sufficient? why do we need to show this run in the "App runs" table?
